t: Jeremiah 9
Oh,*pn that my head were waters, And*ld my eyes a fountain of tears, That*ld I might weep day and night For*ld the slain of the daughter of my people!
Oh,*ld that I had in the wilderness A*ld lodging place for travelers; That*ld I might leave my people, And*ld go from them! For*ld they are*i all adulterers, An*ld assembly of treacherous men.

“And*ln like*i their bow they have bent their tongues for*i lies. They*ld are not valiant for the truth on the earth. For*ld they proceed from evil to evil, And*ld they do not know Me,” says the Lord.*s
“Everyone*ld take heed to his neighbor, And*ld do not trust any brother; For*ld every brother will utterly supplant, And*ld every neighbor will walk with slanderers.
Everyone*ld will deceive his neighbor, And*ld will not speak the truth; They*ld have taught their tongue to speak lies; They*ld weary themselves to commit iniquity.
Your*ld dwelling place is*i in the midst of deceit; Through*ld deceit they refuse to know Me,” says the Lord.*s
Therefore*p thus says the Lord*s of hosts: “Behold,*pn I will refine them and try them; For*ld how shall I deal with the daughter of My people?
Their*ld tongue is*i an arrow shot out; It*ld speaks deceit; One*ild speaks peaceably to his neighbor with his mouth, But*ld in his heart he lies in wait.
Shall*ld I not punish them for these things?”*i says the Lord.*s “Shall*ld I not avenge Myself on such a nation as this?”

I*ld will take up a weeping and wailing for the mountains, And*ld for the dwelling places of the wilderness a lamentation, Because*ld they are burned up, So*ld that no one can pass through; Nor*ld can men*i hear the voice of the cattle. Both*ld the birds of the heavens and the beasts have fled; They*ld are gone.
“I*ln will make Jerusalem a heap of ruins, a den of jackals. I*ld will make the cities of Judah desolate, without an inhabitant.”

Who*p is*i the wise man who may understand this? And who*i is*i he*i to whom the mouth of the Lord*s has spoken, that he may declare it? Why does the land perish and*i burn up like a wilderness, so that no one can pass through?
And*p the Lord*s said, “Because they have forsaken My law which I set before them, and have not obeyed My voice, nor walked according to it,
but they have walked according to the dictates of their own hearts and after the Baals, which their fathers taught them,”
therefore thus says the Lord*s of hosts, the God of Israel: “Behold, I will feed them, this people, with wormwood, and give them water of gall to drink.
I will scatter them also among the Gentiles, whom neither they nor their fathers have known. And I will send a sword after them until I have consumed them.”
The People Mourn in Judgment
Thus*p says the Lord*s of hosts: “Consider*pn and call for the mourning women, That*ld they may come; And*ld send for skillful wailing*i women, That*ld they may come.
Let*ld them make haste And*ld take up a wailing for us, That*ld our eyes may run with tears, And*ld our eyelids gush with water.
For*ld a voice of wailing is heard from Zion: ‘How*ld we are plundered! We*ld are greatly ashamed, Because*ld we have forsaken the land, Because*ld we have been cast out of our dwellings.’”
Yet*ln hear the word of the Lord,*s O women, And*ld let your ear receive the word of His mouth; Teach*ld your daughters wailing, And*ld everyone her neighbor a lamentation.
For*ld death has come through our windows, Has*ld entered our palaces, To*ld kill off the children— no*i longer*i to*i be*i outside! And*ild the young men— no*i longer*i on the streets!
Speak,*p “Thus says the Lord:*s ‘Even*pn the carcasses of men shall fall as refuse on the open field, Like*ld cuttings after the harvester, And*ld no one shall gather them.’”*i
Thus*p says the Lord:*s “Let*pn not the wise man*i glory in his wisdom, Let*ld not the mighty man*i glory in his might, Nor*ld let the rich man*i glory in his riches;

But*ld let him who glories glory in this, That*ld he understands and knows Me, That*ld I am*i the Lord,*s exercising lovingkindness, judgment, and righteousness in the earth. For*ld in these I delight,” says the Lord.*s
“Behold,*p the days are coming,” says the Lord,*s “that I will punish all who*i are*i circumcised with the uncircumcised—

Egypt, Judah, Edom, the people of Ammon, Moab, and all who*i are*i in the farthest corners, who dwell in the wilderness. For all these*i nations are*i uncircumcised, and all the house of Israel are*i uncircumcised in the heart.”
